news_header: The number of individuals with payment defaults in Finland has increased this year.
news_text: According to Suomen Asiakastieto, the number of consumers with payment defaults has risen by 15,000 since the end of last year, totaling 365,500 by the end of September. The increase in first-time payment defaults has been observed across all age groups over the past two years, with the most significant growth in the 20-year-old demographic. Many consumers' financial issues are attributed to unpaid consumer loans.
